snippet: Officials and parents spent the weekend anxious about how to talk to students about Friday’s shooting and how best to discourage something like it from happening again.
abstract: Officials and parents at schools across the nation are worrying not only about how to help children respond to the horrifying carnage at Newtown, Conn elementary school, but about what can be done to prevent another such tragedy; school officials are reviewing safety measures, discussing whether and how to conduct drills and even considering the hiring of security guards.
lead_paragraph: Officials and parents spent the weekend anxious about how to talk to students about Friday’s shooting and how best to discourage something like it from happening again.

headline.seo: In Wake of Newtown Shooting, Grappling With What to Tell the Children
headline.main: The Nation Heads Back to School With New Worries About Safety
headline.print_headline: The Nation Heads Back to School With New Worries About Safety
